page.title: 03Flora off the A52
page.content: Although the{A52}is such a busy road, we noticed a surprising thing about it. It has quite wide verges and a wide central reservation and along these grow a great variety of wild flowers and grasses. Screening the fields from the road are{hawthorn}hedges which are a picture in Spring when they are covered in white blossom and in Autumn when they have red berries. Growing beneath the hedge, the{willow herb}is just coming out. Bright red{poppies dance among clouds of white{cow {parsley,}called kek by country people. There are patches of blue{meadow {cranesbill}and white{campion.}Spiky {thistles}with lovely purple flowers stand out above the smaller flowers of yellow{hedge mustard}and white {mayweed,}while stinging{nettles}deter people from spoiling the beauty.
